Posts.Content: Apologies for bumping in (I finished chemo in the summer - EC then T) but what injections are people talking about? Apart from starting Herceptin with the Taxol, I didn't have any injection and never had anything mentioned about them. Just curious really.
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: After I reported tingling in my hands the first week on Taxol, I had flexible chill pads wrapped round my wrists for the rest of the treatment. I found the weekly Taxol far worse than the 3 weekly EC treatment, although at least my hair started regrowing!
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: We were told to use nail varnish with silicium  on both fingernails and toes before, during and 6 months after Taxol - I've certainly had no nail problems doing this.
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: I also had terrible diarrhea on Taxol to the extent that I was allowed to skip the last one. Rather late in the day I read that some people become lactose intolerant when on it and when I cut out nearly all dairy and switched to lactose free milk my problems stopped immediately, so that could be worth your while to try. Good luck.
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Thanks for the reply, I thought it might be something like that. I've heard of Neulasta from US sites, which is far more expensive! Fortunately my bloods didn't go down too much so presumably I was lucky and didn't need them.
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: I had a lumpectomy, sentinel node , replacement of breast prosthesis  (from mastectomy, other side, 30 years earlier) and removal of port a cath about 4 weeks ago. I'm retired now but I would've been capable of returning to a non manual job well within a fortnight, once I'd stopped having the nurse in to change the dressings. On the other hand, if I'd have had paid sick leave I'd probably have taken a month off. When I had the mastectomy 30 years ago, I took 4/5 months off - there had to be some benefit from having cancer!
Posts.Title: how long off work after lumpectomy and sentinel node biopsy

Posts.Content: I had a breast reconstruction (latismus dorsi?) after a mastectomy 30 years ago and the year later I had a breast reduction/lift because, as they said, "we can't match the droop"!  I was very pleased with the result and had hated wearing an external prosthesis for the year. It still looked good all these years later and the prosthesis only needed changing this year after it was discovered that it had ruptured.
Posts.Title: Reducing the other side?

Posts.Content: I have a certain amount of arthritis in my knees which was made far worse when I was on Taxol. It still isn't back to what it was before and I'm having an xray this week to see whether any actual damage has been done. What it has made me realise is that, if this were to happen again I would not only have little quality of life but pretty well no life at all, because of my specific situation. Obviously this had made me very wary of taking an AI which I should be starting after Christmas but I'm prepared to give it a go if any problems like this are likely to be temporary and return to normal after stopping. The same goes for many other commoin side effects, all of which seem to aggravate or increase existing problems! So really, I'm wondering whether any people who've had joint pain have continued to have it after stopping or switching, in which case I'll refuse and go down the natural route.
Posts.Title: Joint pains on AIs

Posts.Content: I hate the whole "battling cancer"/"losing her fight"/"cancer warrior" terminology - so inappropriate and often hurtful.
Posts.Title: The phrase " kicked cancers Ass"

Posts.Content: Quite - but shameful none the less.
Posts.Title: ploblems with viens after having breast surgery

Posts.Content: I'm surprised to hear that so many people have chemo into their veins. I had a port fitted (removed when they did the lumpectomy) and I thought that was standard these days.
Posts.Title: ploblems with viens after having breast surgery

Posts.Content: That's really quite shocking - so much for the NHS being the envy of the world!
Posts.Title: ploblems with viens after having breast surgery
